Class GuiController

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.view.GuiController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class GuiController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
The main coordinator class for the UI. Acts as the FXML Controller and manages the interaction between Input, Rendering, Game Loop, and Game Logic.
Author:
Abdullah Usmani

  • Constructor Details

    • GuiController

      public GuiController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL location, ResourceBundle resources)
      Initializes the controller after its root element has been completely processed. Sets up the game renderer, focus management, game-over panel logic, and pause logic.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      location - The location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the location is not known.
      resources - The resources used to localize the root object, or null if the root object was not localized.

    • setGameMode

      public void setGameMode(GameMode mode)
      Sets the game mode and initializes mode-specific UI elements. Should be called immediately after loading the controller.
      Parameters:
      mode - The selected GameMode.

    • getBombButton

      public javafx.scene.control.Button getBombButton()
      Initializes the Bomb Panel if the current game mode is BOMB.

    • showNotification

      public void showNotification(String text)
      Displays a temporary notification message on screen.
      Parameters:
      text - The message to display.

    • updateBombButtonState

      public void updateBombButtonState(int count)
      Updates the bomb button state.
      Parameters:
      count - Remaining bombs.

    • returnFocusToGame

      public void returnFocusToGame()
      Returns focus to the game panel so keyboard controls work immediately.

    • setEventListener

      public void setEventListener(InputEventListener eventListener)
      Registers the InputEventListener which handles the game logic for input events. Also initializes the InputHandler and GameLoopManager.
      Parameters:
      eventListener - The listener that processes input events (usually the GameController).

    • initGameView

      public void initGameView(int[][] boardMatrix, ViewData brick)
      Initializes the visual state of the game board. Delegates initial drawing to the GameRenderer and starts the game loop.
      Parameters:
      boardMatrix - The initial state of the board grid.
      brick - The initial data for the current falling brick.

    • moveLeft

      public void moveLeft()
      Initiates a move to the left. Called by the InputHandler when the move left key is pressed.

    • moveRight

      public void moveRight()
      Initiates a move to the right. Called by the InputHandler when the move right key is pressed.

    • rotate

      public void rotate()
      Initiates a rotation of the brick. Called by the InputHandler when the rotate key is pressed.

    • moveDownUser

      public void moveDownUser()
      Initiates a downward movement triggered by the user (soft drop).

    • hardDrop

      public void hardDrop()
      Initiates a hard drop (instant fall). Called by the InputHandler when the hard drop key is pressed.

    • holdBrick

      public void holdBrick()
      Triggers the "Hold Brick" action. Swaps the current brick with the held brick and updates the UI accordingly.

    • refreshGameBackground

      public void refreshGameBackground(int[][] board)
      Refreshes the visual representation of the game board background (static bricks).
      Parameters:
      board - The current state of the board grid.

    • refreshNextBrick

      public void refreshNextBrick(List<int[][]> nextBrickData)
      Updates the "Next Brick" preview panel.
      Parameters:
      nextBrickData - A list of matrices representing the upcoming bricks.

    • refreshHoldBrick

      public void refreshHoldBrick(int[][] holdData)
      Updates the "Hold Brick" preview panel.
      Parameters:
      holdData - A matrix representing the currently held brick.

    • refreshBrick

      public void refreshBrick(ViewData data)
      Refreshes the display of the currently falling brick. Delegates the drawing to the GameRenderer.
      Parameters:
      data - The view data containing the brick's position and shape.

    • isPaused

      public boolean isPaused()
      Checks if the game is currently paused.
      Returns:
      true if the game is paused, false otherwise.

    • isGameOver

      public boolean isGameOver()
      Checks if the game is in a "Game Over" state.
      Returns:
      true if the game is over, false otherwise.

    • isCountingDown

      public boolean isCountingDown()

    • togglePause

      public void togglePause()
      Toggles the pause state of the game. Opens or closes the pause menu overlay accordingly.

    • showPauseMenu

      public void showPauseMenu()
      Displays the pause menu overlay and pauses the game logic.

    • closePauseMenu

      public void closePauseMenu()
      Removes the pause menu overlay and resumes the game logic.

    • newGame

      public void newGame()
      Resets the game UI and Logic to start a fresh game.

    • setGameSpeed

      public void setGameSpeed(double rate)

    • updateLevel

      public void updateLevel(int level)

    • updateSpeed

      public void updateSpeed(double speed)

    • gameOver

      public void gameOver()
      Triggers the Game Over sequence. Stops the game loop and displays the Game Over panel with an animation.

    • bindScore

      public void bindScore(javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty integerProperty)
      Binds the score text display to the logic's score property.
      Parameters:
      integerProperty - The observable integer property representing the score.

    • getHighScoreText

      public String getHighScoreText()
      Retrieves the current high score as a String. Required by PauseMenuController to display the high score.
      Returns:
      The high score as a string.

    • bindHighScore

      public void bindHighScore(javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty highScoreProperty)
      Binds the local high score property to the logic's high score property.
      Parameters:
      highScoreProperty - The observable integer property representing the high score.
